page.title: 02WINSTON
page.content:
WINSTON 1985 The village of Winston lies north of the River Tees, on the main route from Darlington to Barnard Castle. It is best described as a commuter village, due to the absence of local industry. The village had, until recently, been spared from expansion by residential developments, normally associated with rural areas. Recent building at the west end of the village (Highcliff Edge Estate) is of high quality, high cost properties occupied by families with two or three children.
At the west and historic end of the village, development has been to quality development of bunglows, and the altration of farm buuldings into separate residences. One notable aspect with all the recent construction is the use of stone.
